text: [Music]
hey everybody Thomas Joseph here
everybody loves a homemade marshmallow
it's not that hard to do you just need a
few special ingredients and the how-to
and you'll be making marshmallows every
single weekend I have a half a cup of
water here in this mixing bowl and to
that I'm gonna add three packets of
powdered gelatin there is a different
type of gelatin out there in the
marketplace and that is leaf gelatin or
sheet gelatin and this is used mostly in
restaurants and if you have this on hand
you need about four times as much
gelatin in the sheet form then in one of
these packets and I'm using three
packets today so you need quite a few
sheets of gelatin so sprinkle them over
the top of the water and we're gonna let
this mixture sit for about 10 minutes
and this is called blooming the gelatin
the granules will swell with the water
and it will make it easier to
incorporate into the rest of the
ingredients while that's sitting I'm
going to make a sugar syrup so I have a
small saucepan here and to that I'm
going to add two cups of granulated
sugar I'm gonna pour that into the
bottom of my saucepan here I have 2/3 of
a cup of corn syrup I have this brush
lightly with a little bit of vegetable
oil it really helps in having the corn
syrup slide right out it doesn't stick
and a quarter of a cup of water stir
this together over medium-high heat and
I need this to come to a boil and boil
continuously for about a minute before
we're ready to use it with our gelatin
so the sugar syrup has been boiling for
a minute I'm gonna turn my mixer on high
speed and slowly pour it the sugar syrup
down the side of the mixer
so once all of the sugar syrup is in add
a half a teaspoon of salt
and now this needs to whip at high speed
for about 12 minutes until it's nice and
fluffy and it's almost quadrupled in
volume so it's been about 12 minutes I'm
going to add the flavoring now one
teaspoon of vanilla extract you could
use peppermint you could use almonds you
can use orange whatever flavor you like
you can really customize your
marshmallows by your taste and you could
also color them at this stage now so if
you wanted pink marshmallows for
Valentine's Day you could certainly do
that as well I'm gonna turn the speed
down a little bit and I'm gonna finish
preparing my pan now a lot of recipes
out there they say to prepare your pan
with nonstick cooking spray like this I
really don't like using nonstick cooking
spray because I think it has a different
flavor so I like to use a neutral
flavored oil like a safflower oil a
canola oil and I like to brush the
parchment that I'm using and the pan
that I'm using brush all of the utensils
that you're going to use because this
mixture is very very sticky so this is
good to go
remove the bowl with an oiled spatula
like I have here quickly dump the
marshmallow mixture into your pan now
I'm using a 9 by 9 inch pan here I'm
gonna give a little bit of a brush here
with the oil use this offset spatula to
spread the marshmallows into the corners
so now take the pieces of parchment make
sure that they're brushed liberally with
oil so that they do not stick to your
marshmallows and gently place them on
the top I'm gonna fold in the two sides
here so give them a good Pat and then
let them cool for about 2 hours
take some confectioners sugar and
generously dust it on the base of your
board here and I'm going to flip the
marshmallows right on to the
confectioners sugar so now I'm gonna cut
these into 16 squares and just take a
little bit more oil here because you
don't want anything to stick I have a
very thin knife it's long enough to cut
time through the marshmallows I'm gonna
go in half directly here and you may
need to wipe the blade of your knife and
brush it with a little bit more oil if
any marshmallow accumulates on the blade
of the knife you're gonna end up with
uneven cuts on your marshmallow and now
I'll take these two rectangles and I
will cut them in half and then half
again so you have a little over two inch
squares here take a little bit of
confectioner sugar in a large bowl and
gently toss the marshmallows into the
confectioners sugar and there you have
it perfect homemade marshmallows that
are a fun treat for any occasion enjoy
[Music]
